We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch a replay of the fifth Friday Night Poker cash game! Barstool Smitty, Jennifer Tilly, Uncle Ron, The Manz, Sam Simmons, and Jordan Young headline an entertaining $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt and Brent Hanks call the action!

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch a replay of the second Friday Night Poker cash game! Bryn Kenney, Lauren Roberts, Jamie Kerstetter, Alan Richardson, Ken Kohl, and Tia Kajah headline an entertaining and action-packed $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action and Daniel Negreanu makes a guest appearance!

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #8: $25,000 Pot-Limit Omaha final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! John Riordan is the chip leader ahead of Alex Livingston, Sean Winter, Tony Bloom, Matthew Wantman, and Sam Soverel, as the final six play for the $360,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #9: $25,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Justin Bonomo is the chip leader ahead of Seth Davies, Sean Winter, Jason Koon, Brian Rast, and Nick Schulman, as the final six play for the $432,000 first-place prize.

programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

But when tragedy forces him to return, he finds the people he once cared for, have their own intentions for themselves.

programme.title: A Chosen Hope

programme.title: Droppin Bodies

But when Kelsey is tragically murdered by her boyfriend, Julia is left shattered and betrayed. Abandoned by a justice system that fails to bring her daughter's killer to account, she's forced to confront the darkness she once escaped.

programme.title: Zoltan Kaszas: Cat Jokes
programme.desc: Born in Budapest, Hungary and raised in San Diego, California, this comic first stepped onstage at the age of 19 and was hooked immediately.

programme.title: Ryan Erwin: Full Time Quitter
programme.desc: Ryan Erwin looks at his inability in keeping a regular job; Erwin hilariously informs a sold-out Utah crowd why the job they're watching him do is the only one he's able to keep.

programme.title: Willie Barcena: The Truth Hurts
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Willie Barcenas hilarious special, filmed in El Paso, bluntly questions everything from religion and dating to ladies with big feet.

programme.title: Erik Terrell: Live at Helium Comedy Club
programme.desc: Named one of Variety magazines Comics to Watch, heres Erik Terrell in a hilarious stand-up set delivered at his home club in Philly.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 16
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Dan Naturman: A Little Bit Bananas
programme.desc: Dan Naturman delivers a barrage of observational comedy about marriage, Amazon Prime, the unimpressive nature of being an uncle and life's hypocrisies.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Live in New York City
programme.desc: With a shiny happy exterior, an offbeat, demented interior and direction from Rob Zombie, Tom Papas Live In New York City attacks our hilarious attempts at happiness as life piles up around us. He jokes about becoming a parent, family pets, and boundaries for technology.

programme.title: Saul Trujillo: Yolanda
programme.desc: Does Variety's 'top comic to watch look like Selena's murderer? Find out why cruises are terrible and the homeless tent problem isn't what we think.

programme.title: Erik Griffin: AmERIKan Warrior
programme.desc: Fearlessly taking on hot button issues of our time, the raw comic shares his thoughts on White guilt, religion, and the national anthem.

programme.title: Paul Rodriguez: The Here and Wow
programme.desc: Veteran comedian, Paul Rodriguez hits the stage to give his perspectives on life, from being peer pressured into believing in God to claiming to be the village idiot.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford I Could Eat Part 2
programme.desc: Meat's on the menu with Lavell Crawford keeping Burger King humble to their have it your way slogan, godless vegetarians, and why the best chicken is from a house of God.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Gilbert Lawand: Iraqi Born, Georgia Bred
programme.desc: Gilbert Lawand is the American immigrant story whose father came to the US with only $35 his pocket and $4.5 million in stocks and bonds in the bank; can a boy from Iraq become a Southern gentleman?

programme.title: Dominique Witten: Stop Me When I'm Lying!
programme.desc: The stand up comic, actress, and Chappelle's Show" performer gives her signature hot takes regarding the life and times of a modern comedian.

programme.title: Moshe Kasher: Live in Oakland
programme.desc: Back on his home turf Oakland-bred comic and best-selling author, Moshe Kasher, finds comedy in uproarious stories about the people he's met and how they see him.

programme.title: Pete Lee: Tall, Dark, and Pleasant
programme.desc: A look into the comic's outrageous struggles with people-pleasing, relationships, sex, drugs and motion-sensor sinks.

programme.title: Ryan Conner: Live From DC
programme.desc: Comedian Ryan Conner takes the stage to share hilarious stories about his best job, his worst show, and the time he got scammed at a tea ceremony.

programme.title: Nick Cannon: Mr. Showbiz
programme.desc: In his first comedy special, the popular comic actor and musician reveals edgy, honest tales of his failed attempts at being a gangster, his humble roots, marriage, fatherhood and his thoughts about Eminem.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 18
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Tony Hinchcliffe
programme.desc: Tony Hinchcliffe comes to the stage and does stand up.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: The comic performs in St. Louis, discussing Christmas as a child, feeling guilty on Mother's Day, Thanksgiving and Disneyland.

programme.title: Dave Lester: And How Did That Make You Feel
programme.desc: A Brooklyn legend makes his long-awaited streaming stand-up debut with this one-hour special shot on location at NYC's Westside Comedy Club.

programme.title: David Huntsberger: One Headed Beast
programme.desc: This stand-up special takes a unique approach with animated characters, including a robo-scientist and his human-animal assistants.

programme.title: Dennis Regan: Dennisland
programme.desc: The King Of Queens writer comes out swinging hard with his quick wit and flawless delivery in this stand-up special. Presented by Dry Bar Comedy.

programme.title: Warren B. Hall: Mostly Kid Stuff
programme.desc: Simply put, Warren B. Hall is not what you're expecting. He purposely avoids using the white vs. black angle done by many mainstream black comedians.

programme.title: Ruta Madre
programme.desc: A road trip becomes a hilarious journey to self-discovery when a man trying to get over a breakup leaves San Diego to get support from his uncle.

programme.title: Bob Zany: I Think I Handled That Well
programme.desc: Bob Zany performs standup.

programme.title: Bill Squire: Pure BS
programme.desc: The excommunicated Mormon Missionary tackles life's unfairness, absurdities, and controversial topics with his uniquely heartwarming comedic style.

programme.title: Bill Squire: We're Getting Famous
programme.desc: From the Agora Theater in Cleveland, Ohio, hometown comedy legend Bill Squire's comedy special continues to discover the threads connecting his own childhood to his role as a parent.

programme.title: Jermaine Fowler: Give 'Em Hell, Kid
programme.desc: Performing his first ever stand-up special, Jermaine Fowler has a lot to say about being raised by young parents, which shaped his funny worldview.

programme.title: Steven Michael Quezada: The New Mexican
programme.desc: Quezada unloads the painful realities of married life and raising three teenage daughters while being a touring comic and a Breaking Bad star.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk training comes into play.

If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isnt enough for you then youll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty considers a revamp of his cottage garden, divides perennials to get new plants for free and plants bulbs in pots for spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Presenting from York Gate in Leeds, Adam Frost, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill celebrate a garden for all seasons and tackle a bunch of seasonal jobs for September.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A catch-up with three sisters in Dorset to discover how their collapsed greenhouse turned into an opportunity to transform part of their garden. Plus, Monty plants garlic and onions, transplants foxgloves, and prepares his strawberry bed for winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's apple harvest time, and Monty shares tips on what to do with windfalls before planting a container to give a colourful boost for winter insects. Plus, Adam Frost visits a designer who has overcome extreme weather and difficult terrain.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her new garden and assessing the tomatoes in her upcycled greenhouse, while Rekha Mistry shares the successes and failures of her new vegetable garden. Plus, Errol Reuben Fernandes heads to a contemporary garden in Wakefield.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty replants his bearded iris in the Dry Garden, clears the greenhouse ready for winter salad crops and harvests quince. As part of his Cottage Garden revamp, he transplants a shrub to the orchard and shows how to save money by collecting seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost adds tall plants for shady conditions to his borders, demonstrates how to make a window box for growing vegetables and herbs, and gives his tips on how to grow plants successfully in peat-free compost.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts weve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that weve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time weve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. Youll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know youll love it.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Mike Frenette takes Blair off the coast of Louisiana to catch their limit of red snapper.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair tries for an upgrade off the coast of Naples.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway; Shaynna Blaze continues her summer escape to Europe as she cruises through Germany and into Austria.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Merediths beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Toms new Yellowfin 24 Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head into the Everglades backcountry out of Key Largo to fish the shallow grass flats for tailing redfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Saltwater Experience Charters Captain Garrett Stephens for a trip into the Gulf. When their catches get repeatedly cut off, they decide to bring the massive bull sharks up to the surface for a closer look.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After wrestling with some massive bull sharks, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and guest Captain Garrett Stephens encounter some crazy cobia action and it takes all their strength and skill to keep them away from the sharks.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Without a central recycling program in Alaska, waste found and picked up along the coastline didn't have anywhere to go but the local dump. In response, Gulf of Alaska Keeper, a long-time protector of the Alaska shoreline, partners with an all-star team of local and global companies to find an innovative, sustainable solution to transform thousands of pounds of ocean plastic into a usable, in-demand product.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Rivers are Life team joins the Michigan Department of Natural Resources on the St. Clair River to assist in catching and tagging lake sturgeon as part of an ongoing conservation effort. Aboard the DNRs Channel Cat research vessel, we learn about the sturgeon's ecological role, cultural significance, and the challenges the iconic fish facesfrom invasive species to habitat loss. The project supports sturgeon population recovery through egg collection, hatchery programs, and community events like Port Hurons Sturgeon Fest, organized by the Friends of the St. Clair River. Every year since its inception in 2012, Sturgeon Fest has released young sturgeon back into the wild, contributing to the unique species' resurgence in the Great Lakes region. This year, the Rivers are Life team helped tag two juvenile sturgeons, which made their debut in the popular festival's touch tank before release.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: After two years of dedicated practice with his bow, Producer, Ian heads out to the blind to try and get his very first whitetail deer.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Louisianas Cajun Ninja joins Chef Jay Ducote in our latest catch-and-cook adventure. Tag along as they hit up the hottest fishing spots in Plaquemines Parish with Captain Shane York and turn their catches into authentic Cajun meals.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Merediths beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesnt come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Ariel Medero fish with David Moss from the Nature Conservancy out of Hawks Cay sampling the bottom fishing and deep dropping. In between the action they learn about the Nature Conservancys mission to promote sustainable and transparent fishing practices.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards are heads to Table Rock for the annual family vacation. Receding water poses a challenge but theres no lack of fish or laughs at the lake!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Its been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the worlds best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchesters best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. Well also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: For DIRTs first trip across the pond, host Josh Rosen dove head first into Ireland. From long-held traditions to the modern-day artisanal movement, he unearthed the multicultural goldmine between the highlands and the Wild Atlantic Waywith stops for surfing, a seaweed bath, and a couple holes of golf spectated by free-range goats, of course. Foraged cocktails? Fresh crabs from Galway Bay? Its all on the table in this episode rooted in community, homegrown ingredients, and the damn good people who bring it all together. Subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch up on all of DIRTs past adventures.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Atlanta is a city famous for vibrant art and tasty food, so for this episode the DIRT team went looking for the real people behind the scenes working to make this city so special. Josh meets celebrated chefs, barbers, farmers, and even a butter-wrapping machine dubbed Andr 4000 because he's "the second best 'wrapper' in Atlanta"though special guest Killer Mike would probably take issue with that. Thirty years ago the real Andr announced to the world "the South got something to say," so tune in and listen up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

Determined to land a monster first yellowfin tuna, Julie pushes her limitsnot only guiding her friends to hook their inaugural catch, but also aiming to surpass her personal best: a remarkable 180-pound yellowfin.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins Capt. Ozzie in Captiva, FL where the action is fast and furious and they chase down an inshore slam in this beautiful Florida fishery.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Brandon takes us on a special trip to show us what he does on his days off.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Mark Stowe and long time friend Wes Thomas fish with some Indiana, National Guard servicemen. A big thank you for their service to our country.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts weve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that weve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time weve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. Youll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know youll love it.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair tries for an upgrade off the coast of Naples.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway; Shaynna Blaze continues her summer escape to Europe as she cruises through Germany and into Austria.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Merediths beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Toms new Yellowfin 24 Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head into the Everglades backcountry out of Key Largo to fish the shallow grass flats for tailing redfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Saltwater Experience Charters Captain Garrett Stephens for a trip into the Gulf. When their catches get repeatedly cut off, they decide to bring the massive bull sharks up to the surface for a closer look.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After wrestling with some massive bull sharks, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and guest Captain Garrett Stephens encounter some crazy cobia action and it takes all their strength and skill to keep them away from the sharks.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Without a central recycling program in Alaska, waste found and picked up along the coastline didn't have anywhere to go but the local dump. In response, Gulf of Alaska Keeper, a long-time protector of the Alaska shoreline, partners with an all-star team of local and global companies to find an innovative, sustainable solution to transform thousands of pounds of ocean plastic into a usable, in-demand product.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Rivers are Life team joins the Michigan Department of Natural Resources on the St. Clair River to assist in catching and tagging lake sturgeon as part of an ongoing conservation effort. Aboard the DNRs Channel Cat research vessel, we learn about the sturgeon's ecological role, cultural significance, and the challenges the iconic fish facesfrom invasive species to habitat loss. The project supports sturgeon population recovery through egg collection, hatchery programs, and community events like Port Hurons Sturgeon Fest, organized by the Friends of the St. Clair River. Every year since its inception in 2012, Sturgeon Fest has released young sturgeon back into the wild, contributing to the unique species' resurgence in the Great Lakes region. This year, the Rivers are Life team helped tag two juvenile sturgeons, which made their debut in the popular festival's touch tank before release.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: After two years of dedicated practice with his bow, Producer, Ian heads out to the blind to try and get his very first whitetail deer.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Louisianas Cajun Ninja joins Chef Jay Ducote in our latest catch-and-cook adventure. Tag along as they hit up the hottest fishing spots in Plaquemines Parish with Captain Shane York and turn their catches into authentic Cajun meals.

programme.title: Midnight Cabaret
programme.desc: An actress's ideal role turns into a nightmare after she becomes the prime suspect in a series of murders.

programme.title: City By The Sea
programme.desc: A man, as a cop, must bring a criminal to justice--but, as a father, must find a way to save his son.

programme.title: Deathtrap
programme.desc: Sidney Bruhl's latest whodunit is a failure. Only a new smash hit can salvage his reputation and pride, but Sidney is out of ideas.

programme.title: Mr. Troop Mom
programme.desc: Looking to reconnect with his daughter, a career-focused dad becomes a fish out of water when he elects to chaperone her scout troop's camping trip.

programme.title: Disorderlies
programme.desc: Three friends must save a wealthy, ailing curmudgeon from the morbid plans of the man's greedy nephew.

programme.title: Suburban Commando
programme.desc: Forced to take a vacation in a quiet American suburb, an intergalactic warrior must protect his new human friends when bounty hunters track him down.

programme.title: Dungeons & Dragons
programme.desc: When the evil returns years later to avenge what transpired in Izmer, five adventurers and thieves must thwart the traps, ghouls and armies of hell.

programme.title: Jackie Chan's First Strike
programme.desc: Caught between the CIA, the Mafia, and Russian intelligence, a keen yet bumbling cop finds himself at the center of a plot to steal a nuclear warhead.

programme.title: Me and Orson Welles
programme.desc: New York, 1937. Richard (Zac Efron) lucks into a starring role in Orson Welles's production of Julius Caesar.

programme.title: Fandango
programme.desc: Five young men about to graduate from college, take one last trip before facing their lives as adults.

programme.title: The Principal
programme.desc: After taking a bat to the Porsche of his ex-wifes divorce attorney, teacher Rick Latimer is punished with a principal post at a violent high school.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew in WWII must contend with thirsty Nazi troops while crossing the Sahara in search of a fabled water well.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: Solo
programme.desc: A powerful government killing machine with the appearance of a man carries out a series of missions. Soon, this being starts to grow a conscience.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: Armored guards are supposed to ensure no money gets stolen but when a team of guards plans for a heist go wrong, they begin to betray each other.

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: A cop seeking a bone marrow transplant for his gravely ill son finds a match. But the potential donor is an incarcerated killer with ulterior motives.

programme.title: Sunset
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and James Garner star as 1920s legends, actor Tom Mix and crimefighter Wyatt Earp, who join forces to solve a Beverly Hills killing.

programme.title: Lone Star State of Mind
programme.desc: Pressed for time before leaving Texas with his girlfriend, a mechanic must deal with the repercussions of his simple cousins latest bungled crime.

programme.title: The Pest
programme.desc: A manic con man finds himself the prey of a high-speed hunt that migrates from a neo-Nazi's private island to the streets of Miami's South Beach.

programme.title: Sueo
programme.desc: An inspiring story of love and music, Antonio moves from Mexico to Los Angeles to pursue his dreams of sharing his music with the world.

programme.title: Wings of Courage
programme.desc: The film tells the dramatic story of three legendary French aviators and the first historic airmail flights in the Andes. It combines a tale of high adventure and excitement with cutting-edge technology, and is the fulfillment of one of Annaud's long-held dreams.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic 80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter hes testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: A Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: When an Arizona astronomer discovers a comet heading toward Earth, the president attempts to divert it by using a nuclear missile.

programme.title: Talhotblond
programme.desc: Thomas meets a beautiful teenager online, with whom he engages in a nearly two-year romance over the Internet until she learns the truth about him, which leads Thomas to exact the ultimate revenge.

programme.title: My Mom's New Boyfriend
programme.desc: An FBI agent discovers more than he wanted to about his mom when he is ordered to spy on her new boyfriend, a suspect in an art theft investigation.

programme.title: The Body
programme.desc: A Vatican-appointed Jesuit priest and an Israeli archaeologist make a tenuous alliance that threatens the very foundations of Western religion.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: King Arthur's Camelot experienced battles, courage, and love that brought the kingdom to its knees. Along with the passion that made it live forever.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
programme.desc: War widow Janet Ames (Rosalind Russell) is struck by a car, and later her doctors suspect she may have been attempting suicide. A note in her pocket lists five men whom her husband died saving in battle, and they are contacted to help Janet's recovery. The first man on the list, jaded reporter Smitty Cobb (Melvyn Douglas), is offended when Janet says she hopes to prove her husband died in vain to save five worthless men, and offers to "introduce" Janet to each of the men through hypnotism.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: A fearless sailor returns to the kingdom of Thessaly after a 20-year voyage to find the Golden Fleece and make his rightful claim to the throne.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Girls Can Play
programme.desc: A detective investigates the murder of a player on a professional girl's softball team.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier stars in this iconic version of the famous play about a cash poor family who start to fray when they inherit a life insurance payout.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Vctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an expos of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiance (Luz Mrquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Blackjack Ketchum, Desperado
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Howard Duff) wants peace in the valley, but a cattle baron (Victor Jory) and his brothers want war.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Desert Vigilante
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) bags Mexican-border silver smugglers for Uncle Sam.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.title: Bringing Up Baby
programme.desc: Paleontologist David Huxley loses his fossil, his fiance and his freedom.

programme.title: A Face In The Crowd
programme.desc: An Arkansas drifter is discovered by a radio producer and rises to fame on national television.

programme.title: The Music Man

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is not convinced about Mayor David Hicks' plans to revive an annual trip to Brighton, suspecting his proposal to buy coastal land there, is rather a fraudulent scheme. Naturally, he joins the trip, but during their time in Brighton, a hated property developer (Tim McInnerny) is beheaded on a ghost house ride, prompting Barnaby to team up with his cousin to determine whether the developer's renters, the mayor, a gloomy reverend (Mark Gatiss), or the lady of a large estate are responsible, and soon discovers a hotbed of jealously, debt, lies and more, conceal a far darker secret.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Poison: Breaking The Band
programme.desc: In the 1980s, metal band Poison were united in their determination to become rock stars. Through hard work and relentless promotion, they did indeed take the world by storm. Their off-stage excess and partying, along with their female following, was legendary. Festering jealousies and power struggles, worsening addictions, gladiatorial backstage fist fights and ultimately burnout from constant touring and partying were amongst the trials they faced.. So which of these ended up poisoning Poison?

programme.desc: It's full steam ahead when returning customer Mark Bassett brings in a late 1800's Velocipede.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Everything seems like business as usual in West Covina, Calif., until a crazy-looking vintage Mercury Zephyr pulls up, revealing an old friend; Darrell and his buddy stumble over the ultimate sketch artist; Ivy and his son can't seem to pick a lane.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A confident Kenny has a three-step plan for success in Stanton, Calif.; Darrell helps Kimber find winning items for her new boutique; Rene brings Casey, who needs a distraction; Laura takes lead as auctioneer, while Dan holds the clipboard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny's fear of sharks inspires a controversial wardrobe choice; Rene brings his bargain army along to try and intimidate the competition while he gets his slice of the loot; Darrell won't take no for an answer, moving full-steam ahead.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa decides to be fact-based in Placentia, Calif., inadvertently complicating international relations; Ivy and his son conjure up a locker with some mysterious sports equipment; Rene won't be taken advantage of, allowing him to record a nice win.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi does everything she can to stay positive; Darrell finds a unit with some vintage totes, while Gunter plays on Rene's last nerve.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A small animal catches Lisa off guard, though she does snag a new type of prize; Ivy and Isaiah barrel their way through a unit, leaving them in need of a drink; Darrell keeps getting stuck behind an old lady.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Laura takes the reigns alone in Fullerton and proceeds to outsell Dan; Brandi gets assaulted by her locker but ultimately drives home a winner; Rene postpones a day date in favor of a work date; Darrell stumbles across an unexpected collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene shows up in Orange, declaring himself the king, while Dusty isn't quite ready to concede the title; Kenny accidentally reinvents the wheel; Lisa sees things from a slightly different perspective.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell has to deal with Kimber's eyes on a competitor; Ivy brings a full truck, hoping for a second haul; Dusty unpacks what could be the ultimate assistant; Rene's hunch serves him well, putting together one of his greatest profits.
